abstract.p: Certain perennials will help attract bees and butterflies well into fall (S)

block.p: Attract bees and butterflies well into fall with clumps of familiar perennials like asters, butterfly weed and hyssop and underused ones like mountain mint (Pycnanthemum muticum), ironweed (Vernonia noveboracensis) and leadwort (Ceratostigma plumbaginoides). Seven-son flower (Heptacodium miconioides) is an underused small tree whose many virtues include panicles of small, white flowers that smell of nutmeg and tuberose and are alive with blissful bees and butterflies through September.

Plenty of splashing water this year explains why the fungus that causes black spot on roses won't give up. Continue cleaning up infected leaves; letting them accumulate under the rose will guarantee infections again next year. Wet conditions also promote wildfire growth of gray mold on ripening raspberries. Don't leave moldy fruit on canes; botrytis lives on the fruit and will overwinter where it falls to the ground.
